title: 10 Lamplight Lounge Secret Menu Items You Won’t Want to Miss

steps.title: A fun fruity cocktail topped with lemon-lime foam.
steps.content: A fun fruity cocktail topped with lemon-lime foam. This colorful tropical drink is perfect to sip at the bar, where you have the perfect view of Mickey’s Fun Wheel. Layered with pineapple juice, X-Rated Passion Fruit Vodka, and a mixture of gin, vodka, light rum, sweet and sour, and blue curaçao, this twist on the classic Long Island ice tea is a great addition to the happiest place on earth. [1] X Research source

steps.title: A layered Long Island perfect for life on the sea.
steps.content: A layered Long Island perfect for life on the sea. Another spin on the classic Long Island iced tea, the Black Pearl is a dark drink with depths of flavor. [2] X Research source It’s made with a mixture of vodka, gin, rum, sweet and sour, Triple-Sec, Chambord (which is a kind of French raspberry-flavored liqueur), and Sprite, garnished with a lemon wheel.

steps.title: An emerald drink to put you in the Pixieland spirit.
steps.content: An emerald drink to put you in the Pixieland spirit. This secret drink is made of a mixture of vodka, rum, gin, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, Sprite, and Midori. Garnished with a pineapple slice and a cherry on top, the Neverland Tea is a tasty cocktail that never grows out of style. [3] X Research source

steps.title: A pick-me-up when you’re feeling undead.
steps.content: A pick-me-up when you’re feeling undead. This drink is a rum lover’s dream: light rum, dark rum, coconut rum, spiced rum, and 151 rum, all topped with orange juice, pineapple juice, blue curaçao, Midori, and grenadine. This spooky greenish-brown drink is sure to revive any adventure-park goer. [4] X Research source

steps.title: An incredible cocktail to knock you off your feet.
steps.content: An incredible cocktail to knock you off your feet. Heed the name’s warning—this drink is said to be the strongest on the menu. Another variation of a Long Island iced tea, this delicious drink is layered with vodka, light rum, gin, blue curaçao, 151-Proof rum, sweet and sour, and Sprite. [5] X Research source

steps.title: An oceanic drink that’s definitely something to shell-abrate.
steps.content: An oceanic drink that’s definitely something to shell-abrate. Straight from the depths of the ocean, this drink is mixed with raspberry vodka, blue curaçao, peach schnapps, cranberry juice, and soda water. Garnished with a raspberry wrapped in an orange slice, this cocktail is a favorite among Lamplight Lounge lovers.

steps.title: A unique throwback to celebrate the park’s magical origins.
steps.content: A unique throwback to celebrate the park’s magical origins. This drink was originally from the secret menu of the Cove Bar, which was later replaced by Lamplight Lounge—but the flavor is still just as delicious! A Long Island iced tea with strawberry puree and Regale Berry-Rose Champagne, this beautiful pink drink is garnished with a strawberry and a lemon wheel.

steps.title: A show-stopping drink with tons of fruity flavor.
steps.content: A show-stopping drink with tons of fruity flavor. This is another drink originally from the Cove Bar's secret menu, but it’s definitely more underground. You might have to ask your bartender to custom-make this one, since some may not be aware of it. This mouthwatering red drink is made with Absolut Wild Tea Vodka, iced tea, strawberry puree, and fresh lemon juice, topped with a strawberry and two cherries.

steps.title: A mouth-puckering slightly sweet and sour martini.
steps.content: A mouth-puckering slightly sweet and sour martini. This beautiful cranberry martini is made with Absolut Orient Apple Vodka, Domaine de Canton Ginger Liqueur, cranberry juice, organic agave nectar, and fresh lime juice.

steps.title: A plate of nachos topped with whatever protein you desire.
steps.content: A plate of nachos topped with whatever protein you desire. One of the most famous meals at Lamplight Lounge is the Lobster Nachos. Here’s another secret: if you don’t like lobster, you can order your nachos with chicken or steak instead. If you don’t eat meat at all, don’t worry! You can also order your nachos vegetarian-style. You can modify a lot of the other dishes to be vegetarian too, so be sure to ask your waiter for more options.
